matterId.description: The ID of the matter to create the saved query in.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

SavedQuery.description: The definition of a saved query. To work with Vault resources, the account must have the [required Vault privileges](https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2799699) and access to the matter. To access a matter, the account must have created the matter, have the matter shared with them, or have the **View All Matters** privilege.

createTime.description: Output only. The server-generated timestamp when the saved query was created.

displayName.description: The name of the saved query.

matterId.description: Output only. The matter ID of the matter the saved query is saved in. The server does not use this field during create and always uses matter ID in the URL.

savedQueryId.description: A unique identifier for the saved query.

Query.description: The query definition used for search and export.

corpus.description: The Google Workspace service to search.

endTime.description: The end time for the search query. Specify in GMT. The value is rounded to 12 AM on the specified date.

method.description: The entity to search. This field replaces **searchMethod** to support shared drives. When **searchMethod** is **TEAM_DRIVE**, the response of this field is **SHARED_DRIVE**.

startTime.description: The start time for the search query. Specify in GMT. The value is rounded to 12 AM on the specified date.

timeZone.description: The time zone name. It should be an IANA TZ name, such as "America/Los_Angeles". For a list of time zone names, see [Time Zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones). For more information about how Vault uses time zones, see [the Vault help center](https://support.google.com/vault/answer/6092995#time).

emails.description: A set of accounts to search.

locationQuery.description: Matches only those events whose location contains all of the words in the given set. If the string contains quoted phrases, this method only matches those events whose location contain the exact phrase. Entries in the set are considered in "and". Word splitting example: ["New Zealand"] vs ["New","Zealand"] "New Zealand": matched by both "New and better Zealand": only matched by the later

minusWords.description: Matches only those events that do not contain any of the words in the given set in title, description, location, or attendees. Entries in the set are considered in "or".

peopleQuery.description: Matches only those events whose attendees contain all of the words in the given set. Entries in the set are considered in "and".

responseStatuses.description: Matches only events for which the custodian gave one of these responses. If the set is empty or contains ATTENDEE_RESPONSE_UNSPECIFIED there will be no filtering on responses.

versionDate.description: Search the current version of the Calendar event, but export the contents of the last version saved before 12:00 AM UTC on the specified date. Enter the date in UTC.

clientSideEncryptedOption.description: Set whether the results include only content encrypted with [Google Workspace Client-side encryption](https://support.google.com/a?p=cse_ov) content, only unencrypted content, or both. Defaults to both. Currently supported for Drive.

includeSharedDrives.description: Set to **true** to include shared drives.

includeTeamDrives.description: Set to true to include Team Drive.

versionDate.description: Search the current version of the Drive file, but export the contents of the last version saved before 12:00 AM UTC on the specified date. Enter the date in UTC.

roomId.description: A list of Chat spaces IDs, as provided by the [Chat API](https://developers.google.com/chat). There is a limit of exporting from 500 Chat spaces per request.

HangoutsChatOptions.description: Additional options for Google Chat search

includeRooms.description: For searches by account or organizational unit, set to **true** to include rooms.

clientSideEncryptedOption.description: Specifies whether the results should include encrypted content, unencrypted content, or both. Defaults to including both.

orgUnitId.description: The name of the organizational unit to search, as provided by the [Admin SDK Directory API](https://developers.google.com/admin-sdk/directory/).

sharedDriveIds.description: A list of shared drive IDs, as provided by the [Drive API](https://developers.google.com/drive).

SitesUrlInfo.description: The published site URLs of new Google Sites to search

urls.description: A list of published site URLs.

teamDriveIds.description: List of Team Drive IDs, as provided by the [Drive API](https://developers.google.com/drive).

$block: The definition of a saved query. To work with Vault resources, the account must have the [required Vault privileges](https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2799699) and access to the matter. To access a matter, the account must have created the matter, have the matter shared with them, or have the **View All Matters** privilege.

$ul: **createTime**: Output only. The server-generated timestamp when the saved query was created.
**displayName**: The name of the saved query.
**matterId**: Output only. The matter ID of the matter the saved query is saved in. The server does not use this field during create and always uses matter ID in the URL.
**query**: The query definition used for search and export.
**accountInfo**: The accounts to search
**emails**: A set of accounts to search.
**calendarOptions**: Additional options for Calendar search

**locationQuery**: Matches only those events whose location contains all of the words in the given set. If the string contains quoted phrases, this method only matches those events whose location contain the exact phrase. Entries in the set are considered in "and". Word splitting example: ["New Zealand"] vs ["New","Zealand"] "New Zealand": matched by both "New and better Zealand": only matched by the later
**minusWords**: Matches only those events that do not contain any of the words in the given set in title, description, location, or attendees. Entries in the set are considered in "or".
**peopleQuery**: Matches only those events whose attendees contain all of the words in the given set. Entries in the set are considered in "and".
**responseStatuses**: Matches only events for which the custodian gave one of these responses. If the set is empty or contains ATTENDEE_RESPONSE_UNSPECIFIED there will be no filtering on responses.
**versionDate**: Search the current version of the Calendar event, but export the contents of the last version saved before 12:00 AM UTC on the specified date. Enter the date in UTC.
**corpus**: The Google Workspace service to search.
**dataScope**: The data source to search.
**driveOptions**: Additional options for Drive search

**clientSideEncryptedOption**: Set whether the results include only content encrypted with [Google Workspace Client-side encryption](https://support.google.com/a?p=cse_ov) content, only unencrypted content, or both. Defaults to both. Currently supported for Drive.
**includeSharedDrives**: Set to **true** to include shared drives.
**includeTeamDrives**: Set to true to include Team Drive.
**versionDate**: Search the current version of the Drive file, but export the contents of the last version saved before 12:00 AM UTC on the specified date. Enter the date in UTC.
**endTime**: The end time for the search query. Specify in GMT. The value is rounded to 12 AM on the specified date.
**hangoutsChatInfo**: The Chat spaces to search
**roomId**: A list of Chat spaces IDs, as provided by the [Chat API](https://developers.google.com/chat). There is a limit of exporting from 500 Chat spaces per request.
**hangoutsChatOptions**: Additional options for Google Chat search
**includeRooms**: For searches by account or organizational unit, set to **true** to include rooms.
**mailOptions**: Additional options for Gmail search
**clientSideEncryptedOption**: Specifies whether the results should include encrypted content, unencrypted content, or both. Defaults to including both.
**excludeDrafts**: Set to **true** to exclude drafts.
**method**: The entity to search. This field replaces **searchMethod** to support shared drives. When **searchMethod** is **TEAM_DRIVE**, the response of this field is **SHARED_DRIVE**.
**orgUnitInfo**: The organizational unit to search
**orgUnitId**: The name of the organizational unit to search, as provided by the [Admin SDK Directory API](https://developers.google.com/admin-sdk/directory/).
**searchMethod**: The search method to use.
**sharedDriveInfo**: The shared drives to search
**sharedDriveIds**: A list of shared drive IDs, as provided by the [Drive API](https://developers.google.com/drive).
**sitesUrlInfo**: The published site URLs of new Google Sites to search
**urls**: A list of published site URLs.
**startTime**: The start time for the search query. Specify in GMT. The value is rounded to 12 AM on the specified date.
**teamDriveInfo**: Team Drives to search
**teamDriveIds**: List of Team Drive IDs, as provided by the [Drive API](https://developers.google.com/drive).
**terms**: Service-specific [search operators](https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2474474) to filter search results.

**timeZone**: The time zone name. It should be an IANA TZ name, such as "America/Los_Angeles". For a list of time zone names, see [Time Zone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones). For more information about how Vault uses time zones, see [the Vault help center](https://support.google.com/vault/answer/6092995#time).
**voiceOptions**: Additional options for Voice search
**coveredData**: Datatypes to search
**savedQueryId**: A unique identifier for the saved query.
